Legal_Issue: Whether the April 20, 1994 letter constitutes a new decision subject to judicial review
Application_Facts: The April 20, 1994 letter reviewed new arguments and reaffirmed the refusal of the visa application
Decision_Outcome: The April 20, 1994 letter is a valid decision; judicial review was timely
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the visa refusal
Court_Ruling: Respondent's motion dismissed; judicial review allowed for both February 8 and April 20 decisions
Defendant_Behavior: Respondent claimed the judicial review was untimely
Grounds_for_Claim: Visa refusal and timeliness of judicial review
Legal_Standard: Judicial review must be sought within 30 days of a decision under s. 18.1 of the Federal Court Act
Assessment_Factor: Whether the April 20 letter was a new decision or a courtesy response
Procedural_Issue: Timeliness of filing for judicial review
Application_Basis: New arguments were presented and considered in the April 20 letter
Relief_Sought: Allowance of judicial review of the immigration decision
Governing_Rule: A visa officer may review prior decisions unless functus officio
Outcome: Judicial review permitted; motion to dismiss denied
Cause_Description: Applicant sought review of visa refusal; respondent claimed untimely filing
Decision_Rationale: The April 20 letter constituted a new decision because it reviewed new arguments and reaffirmed the refusal
Legal_Standard_Applied: 30-day deadline for judicial review under s. 18.1
